column4: dct:DESCRIPTION
Statistical post-processing methods related to atmospheric dynamics.
Methods to compute present weather

Quality Control methods in Statistical Post-processing (StatPP) assess observational and forecast data for realism and meteorological consistency.  Suspect data are often set to missing to avoid unwanted effects on StatPP methods.
Statistical Methods
Methods for computing characteristics of cloud cover
NBM methods generally combine data from a collection of Statistical Post-processing (StatPP) and Numerical Weather Prediction (NWP) systems to yield a consensus forecast.
Statistical post-processing methods that are arithmetic calculations
Methods that are used to assign any valid value of a continuous variable to a single category without ambiguity
Concepts that support general functionality in operations
Ingest methods read data that are generally not encoded according to CAMPS formats and conventions and writes these data in a CAMPS-compliant format.
Geospatial calculations
Statistical post-processing methods related to atmospheric thermodynamics
Application of the Model Output Statistics technique to NWP data
Application of the LAMP technique to NWP data
Collection of statistical (mainly regression) parameters generated by application of the MOS technique
Concepts associated with the application of the Model Output Statistics (MOS) technique to output from the NWS Global Forecast System (GFS)
Concepts associated with the application of the Model Output Statistics (MOS) technique to output from the NWS North American Mesoscale (NAM) forecast system
Versions of the National Blend of Models (NBM).
Methods used to categorize QPF

Method for categorizing QPF into 6 mutually exclusive and exhaustive (MEAE) categories.  This categorization was developed specifically for METAR observations and assumes a precision of 0.01 inches:  0=no pcpn; 1=0.01 to 0.09 inches; 2=0.10 to 0.24 inches; 3=0.25 to 0.49 inches; 4=0.50 to 0.99 inches; 5=1.00 to 1.99 inches; 6=2.00 inches or more.  Downloading each category with metadata will yield a machine-readable interpretation.
Operational status
Role in operations
